comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message when a user attempts to access or submit information due to an incorrect password. It appears in various UI elements such as dialogs and panels where password validation is performed, indicating that the provided password is invalid.

usage.context:
<FieldContainer
 className="form-field password-field"
 isVertical
 labelVisible={false}
 hasError={isPasswordErrorShow ? !passwordValid : undefined}
 errorMessage={t("Common:IncorrectPassword")}
 >
 <PasswordInput
 className="confirm-input"
 simpleView={false}
 passwordSettings={passwordSettings}

</Text>
 <FieldContainer
 isVertical
 labelVisible={false}
 hasError={isPasswordErrorShow ? !passwordValid : undefined}
 errorMessage={t("Common:IncorrectPassword")}
 >
 <PasswordInput
 simpleView={false}
 passwordSettings={passwordSettings}
 id="password"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian translation 'Password errata' is not the most natural or idiomatic way to say 'Incorrect password'. While technically correct, it sounds somewhat formal and less conversational.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Password sbagliata' or 'Password non corretta' instead. 'Password sbagliata' is a more common and natural phrasing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation '無効のパスワード' translates to 'invalid password', not 'incorrect password'. While similar, 'incorrect' has a slightly different nuance that isn't captured.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: パスワードが正しくありません (Pasuwaado ga seikaku de arimasen) - 'The password is not correct'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'ລະຫັດລັບບໍ່ຖືກຕ້ອງ' is a literal translation, it could be perceived as overly formal or technical for a simple 'Incorrect password' message. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ບັດບໍ່ຖືກຕ້ອງ' or 'ລະບັດຜິດ' as more common and understandable alternatives.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Palavra-chave incorreta" is understandable, a more natural and common translation of "Incorrect password" in Portuguese would be "Senha incorreta". "Palavra-chave" is more accurately translated to 'keyword'.
